confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at 2:50â€¯pm local time on 26â€¯Novemberâ€¯2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Taiâ€¯Po, Hongâ€¯Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
Seven of the eight blocks in the 2,000â€‘unit complex were engulfed by the fire.
Maintenance scaffolding made of bamboo was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s spread.
Firefighters classified the blaze as a 5â€‘level fire, the highest severity rating.
No Korean nationals were reported among the casualties.
